title: Mario Čuić
text:
Mario Čuić (born 22 April 2001) is a <a href="Croatia">Croatia</a>n professional <a href="Association%20football">football</a> player, playing for <a href="Croatian%20First%20Football%20League">Prva HNL</a> club <a href="HNK%20Hajduk%20Split">Hajduk Split</a>. Čuić's preferred playing position is as an <a href="attacking%20midfielder">attacking midfielder</a>.
Club career.
Mario Čuić was born in <a href="Split%2C%20Croatia">Split</a>, but raised in Brišnik, a village in the municipality of <a href="Tomislavgrad">Tomislavgrad</a>, <a href="Bosnia%20and%20Herzegovina">Bosnia and Herzegovina</a>. He started his football career at local club <a href="HNK%20Tomislav">Tomislav</a>. He moved to neighbouring Croatia, joining the <a href="HNK%20Hajduk%20Split%20Reserves%20and%20Academy">youth academy</a> of famed <a href="Dalmatia">Dalmatia</a>n club <a href="HNK%20Hajduk%20Split">Hajduk Split</a> in 2015. In late 2019, he signed a five-year contract with Hajduk.
Čuić made his debut for Hajduk on 11 June 2020, earning a place in the starting eleven and playing 66 minutes in a 1–0 win over <a href="NK%20Istra%201961">Istra 1961</a>. Aged 19, Čuić scored his first and second Hajduk goals in the <a href="Eternal%20derby%20%28Croatia%29">Eternal derby</a> in a 3–2 win over <a href="GNK%20Dinamo%20Zagreb">Dinamo Zagreb</a> at <a href="Stadion%20Maksimir">Stadion Maksimir</a>. The goals came in his sixth ever professional appearance.
